Michele Vascellari

I am not sure but the ".zip" often indicates that the text/ascii files
follow
the MSDOS end-of-line convention, "\r\n" as opposed to the unix 
end-of-line convention "\n",  If you recursive run the "flip" or
"dos2unix" command 
on the source files this might fix the problem.

Dave

>>> vascellari@... 4/14/2004 4:58:36 AM >>>
Dear all,
I'm a new Cantera user, and I would to compile Cantera on Linux 
(Mandrake 9.1), and after use Cantera from my Fortran 77 program to 
simulate Power System.
I download the last release of Cantewra from SourceForge:

Cantera-1.5.3-src.zip

First of all the configuration file ./configure  is not an executable 
file, so I run the command:

 >chmod +x configure

and after I run the configuration:

 > ./configure

But I obtain the strange message:

: bad interpreter: No such file or directory

I've done the same thing with the 1.5.2 release without problems.

Thanks,

Michele Vascellari
